description.p: DESCRIPTION
Title: "SELF-SUPPORTING CONSTRUCTION MODULE, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF REINFORCED-CONCRETE SLABS" .

In its general aspect, the present invention refers to a self-supporting construction module adapted for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs, which can be made of a plurality of panels made from a plastic or cardboard material, which are joined together with connection means to form a slab, on which concrete is cast so as to form the actual reinforced-concrete plane .
For the purposes of the present invention by slab we mean that structure which is used to create the ceiling of the rooms positioned below it and the floor of the rooms positioned above it.
The slabs can be made of various types of materials, wood, iron, reinforced-concrete etc...

As it is known, in the field of building constructions, construction modules made from expanded plastic material are used, preferably made from expanded polystyrene, in the form of boards or profiles with suitable shapes and dimensions, having the function of thermal insulation. It is also known that in order to confer suitable self-supporting characteristics to said constructive modules it is necessary to incorporate or insert in the mass of plastic material one or more reinforcement profiles made from metal, or wood, plastic material or in any case other rigid material, that is suitably shaped.
One slab of such a type is described in the Italian patent application PN2008A000092 which describes a self-supporting construction module comprising a substantially parallelepiped-shaped plate, having a lower surface that is substantially smooth and in which along at least one of the two longitudinal or transverse directions of the plate itself at least a cavity or recess is defined in which at least one longitudinal reinforcement element is inserted. In said recesses constraint elements for a false-ceiling or for similar elements are inserted.

In general, the longitudinal reinforcing elements are inserted in longitudinal slots made with suitable dimensions. This, however, often implies that the insertion operations of said reinforcements are difficult, due to the friction between the walls of the slots and the reinforcement itself. On the other hand, if the slots are too wide, the reinforcement can move and not achieve its strengthening purpose.

The present invention proposes to avoid the aforementioned drawbacks, while at the same time improving also the strength or self-supporting characteristics of a structure formed by a plurality of modules, in which in each module there is the presence of longitudinal slots in which profiles are inserted which longitudinally cross each module and are inserted in each following module for the entire length of the structure formed.

The slots have variable width so as to ease the insertion of mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, to guarantee the keeping of said reinforcements inside
the module. In particular, during the insertion inside the module, each slot has a width that is greater than the thickness of the reinforcement so as to ease the insertion, whereas in its intermediate portions and/or also near the outlet it has a width that substantially corresponds to the thickness of the reinforcement, so as to hold it, bonding it inside the module.

In such a way the profiles are sufficiently constrained to the panels, determining the balanced strengthening of the structure itself and at the same time avoiding movement of the panels with respect to the profiles. One aspect of the present invention concerns a self- supporting construction module having the characteristics of the attached claim 1.

The characteristics and the advantages of the self- supporting construction module according to the present invention shall be highlighted by the following description, given as an example and not for limiting purposes, given with reference to the attached figures, in which:
- figure 1 illustrates two construction modules constrained to one another according to a first embodiment of the present invention;
- figures 2a and 2b illustrate two head-on views, front and rear, respectively, of the modules of figure 1;
- figure 3a illustrates a side view of the modules of figure 1;
- figure 3b illustrates a side and partially section view of the modules of figure 1;

- figure 3c illustrates a longitudinal section of
the modules of figure 1, taken along the plane B-B indicated in figure 2a;
- figure 3d illustrates an enlarged detail of figure 3b
- figure 4 illustrates a top view of the modules of figure 1;
- figures 5a and 5b illustrate a perspective view and a side view of a constraint element of the modules of figure 1, respectively;
- figure 6 illustrates the modules of figure 1, which have elements for increasing the thickness positioned above.

With reference to the mentioned figures the self- supporting construction module according to the present invention comprises a substantially parallelepiped- shaped body or plate 2, for example made of an expanded plastic material, like expanded polystyrene, having a substantially flat lower surface and in which at least one groove 3 is defined, preferably formed on the upper surface and along at least one of the two directions, longitudinal or transversal, of the plate itself. Preferably, the construction module moreover, on the rear and front surfaces 4 and 5 of the plate, is equipped with protrusions 41 and seats 51, having a mutually united shape, so as to be able to associate a plurality of plates one to the other, so as to form a complete slab structure. In an alternative embodiment said protrusions and seats may not be present and the plates are simply rested against one another.

The construction module further comprises at least one longitudinal or transversal reinforcing element 6,
which is inserted in longitudinal slots 7 which extend for the entire length of the body.

The slots have variable width lengthwise, so as to ease the insertion in mutually aligned modules of the longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, to guarantee the keeping of said reinforcements inside the module. In particular, in inlet to the module each slot has a width that is greater than the thickness of the reinforcement, so as to ease the insertion, whereas in its intermediate portions and/or also near the outlet it has a width that substantially corresponds to the thickness of the reinforcement, so as to grip to it, bonding it inside the module.

In the embodiment, illustrated in figures 1-6, said slots have one of the two longitudinal openings that is greater than the other, so as to ease the insertion (from the larger opening) of the longitudinal reinforcing element in the modules constraint together. Indeed, the shape of the slots makes it possible, during the operations of insertion of the longitudinal reinforcement, to minimize the strain due to friction with the walls of the slot. Moreover, the effects of possible small misalignments at the mouth of the reinforcement can be avoided. In particular, said slots have a front inlet opening 71 for the reinforcement element having greater dimensions with respect to a rear outlet 72 of the reinforcement itself.
Preferably, the slot at its inside has a shape of a truncated cone.
Said a reinforcing element is preferably made from a rigid, metal, wooden or plastic material.

Even more preferably it is made by means of a metal
profile .
The reinforcing element advantageously has a "Z" , C, T,
I, Ω shape, which are shapes which withstand strong longitudinal stress, which the structure may undergo. Preferably, the slot has in section substantially the same shape as the reinforcing element.

Said slots are preferably but not exclusively formed at protrusions 41 and at seats 51. In such a way, it is easier to obtain the correspondence between inlet openings and outlet openings in adjacent modules, further easing the insertion of the reinforcing element between said two modules .

According to the present invention, in at least one groove 3 of the plate, preferably in each of them, the module comprises constraint elements 8 for a false- ceiling or for similar elements (for example metal elements, which in turn bond with panels of a false- ceiling) .

Said constraint elements, visible in detail in figures 5a and 5b, can be embedded in the groove during the fabrication of plate 2, or inserted in a housing 31 formed on the edge of the groove itself, as shown in the described embodiment .

Said constraint elements are essentially made by means of a blade, for example made of metal, comprising at least a "C" -shaped portion 81 and a little vertical plate 82, which extends from one of the horizontal branches of such a "C" shape .

The C-shaped portion and the little plate are preferably made as a single piece, for example through bending of a little metal bar. The C-shaped portion is
adapted for receiving inside it the edge of lower groove 2 in aforementioned housing 31.
The upper little plate has holes 83 and remains free inside groove 3 and when concrete is cast on the ceiling structure it creates a stable bond between plates 2 and the concrete itself in groove 3.

Moreover, on the base of such a "C" -shaped portion, there is a little hole 84 that is adapted for example for the constraint itself of the element with the plate. In said a hole self-tapping screws can be advantageously inserted.

The slab structure is formed by using a plurality of plates 2 that are arranged in series joined together by means of the aforementioned protrusions and seats 41 and 51 and subsequently held together also through the insertion of the reinforcing elements.

On one of the two front surfaces of a module, at least one recess 21 is formed, for example in the shape of a parallelepiped and on the other a correspondent shape 22 extends, adapted for being inserted in the recess of an adjacent module, which together with protrusions 41 inserted in seats 51 determine the formation of guide means for joining two modules in the correct manner. Said modules can be adjusted in height so as to be able to satisfy different requirements. Indeed, a height adapter 10 having analogous dimensions as those of the module and that reproduces the upper surface, can be associated to each module. In particular, on its upper surface there is a longitudinal dovetail guide 11, corresponding to a longitudinal dovetail guide 23 present on the upper surface of each module. Moreover, on the lower surface of the adapter there is a
projecting longitudinal element 12 having a section adapted for fitting in guide 23 of the module or in a guide 11 of another adapter. In such a way, the adapter is constraint to the module and, according to the requirements, one or more adapters can be arranged stacked on every module, so as to be able to vary the overall thickness of the structure as desired. Alternatively, if there are no guides, said adapters can be constrained in another manner to the module, for example glued.

claim.claim-text: 1. Self-supporting construction module, for the construction of reinforced-concrete slabs, comprising
• a substantially parallelepiped body or plate (2) in which in at least one longitudinal direction of the plate itself is defined at least one groove (3) for its entire length,
• said plates having a mutually united shape, in order to associate a plurality of plates one to the other, such as to form a complete slab structure, formed by a plurality of said modules,
• at least one longitudinal reinforcing element (6) , which is inserted in longitudinal slots (7)
extending for the entire length of the body;
said slots having a variable width in order to ease the insertion of mutually aligned modules of the
longitudinal reinforcing element and, in the meantime, in order to guarantee the keeping of said
reinforcements inside the module;
characterized in that said slots have a front opening (71) for the inlet of the reinforcing element (6) having greater sizes with respect to rear outlet (72) .
2. Module according to claim 1, wherein at the inlet in the module each slot has a width wider than the

reinforcing thickness, in order to ease its insertion, whereas in its intermediate portions and/or also near the outlet it has a width substantially correspondent to the thickness of the reinforcement .
3. Module according to claim 1, wherein the slot has an inner truncated-cone shape.

4. Module according to claim 1, wherein on the rear (4) and front (5) surfaces of the plate protrusions (41) and seats (51) are provided, having a mutually united shape, in order to ease the alignment of a plurality of plates one to the other.
5. Module according to claim 4, wherein said slots are preferably provided at the protrusions and the seats.
6. Module according to claim 1, wherein in at least one groove (3) of the plate, the module comprises
constraint elements (8) for a false ceiling or similar elements.

7. module according to claim 6, wherein said constraint elements are essentially realized by means of a blade, comprising at least one "C" portion (81) for housing the edge of the groove and a little vertical plate (82) extending from one of the horizontal branches of said "C" .
8. Module according to claim 7, wherein the little plate has holes (83) and it remains free inside the groove (3) and when on the ceiling structure, once the
concrete has been laid, it creates a stable bond between the plates (2) and the concrete itself in the groove .
9. Module according to claim 7, wherein at the base of said "C" portion a little hole (84) is present, for constraining itself between the element and the plate.
10. Module according to claim 1, wherein the reinforcing element has a "Z" , C, T, I, Ω shape and the groove has a section substantially with the same shape.
11. Module according to claim 1, wherein at each module a height adapter (10) can be associated, having the same sizes of the module and reproducing its upper surface .
12. Module according to claim 11, wherein on the upper surface of the adapter a dovetail guide (11) is
provided, corresponding to a longitudinal dovetail guide (23) provided on the upper surface of each module, on the lower surface of the adapter a
longitudinal protruding element (12) is provided, having a section for being inserted in the guide (23) of the module or in a guide (11) of another adapter.
